alert.note: Alert for Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Warning for the Slate River and its Tributaries in Northern Buckingham County... ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive runoff from prior very heavy rainfall during the last three days. * WHERE...Buckingham County Virginia in Central Virginia. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM EDT, The gauge on the Slate River at Arvonia has reached the flood stage of 12.0 feet as of 300 PM EDT this afternoon. The river is continuing to rise and will likely crest near 12.2 feet this evening. This flooding is the result of runoff from prior heavy rainfall and completely saturated soils during the past several days. - In addition to the Slate River, this includes the following streams and drainges... Sharps Creek, Muddy Creek, Rocky Creek, James River, Slate River and Crooked Creek. - This will impact mainly rural areas of Northern Buckingham County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away from creeks, streams, and rivers. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
